questions.question: What is the organization for most of the essay?
The main idea of the first section is which of the following sentences:

choices.answer: Tens of thousands of people have been implanted with deep brain simulators
We're in the midst of a bionic revolution, yet most of us don't know it.
Around 220,000 people worldwide already walk around with cochlear implants
devices worn around the ear that turn sound waves into electrical impulses

questions.question: Which of the following things support the main idea of the section 1: "We're in the midst of a bionic revolution..."

choices.answer: monkey moving an arm miles away

questions.question: How does the author organize the first 17 paragraphs?

choices.answer: by showing how uncertain he is
by giving a call to action
by providing examples of the bionic revolution

questions.question: One way the author supports the title "Superhuman Frontier" is

choices.answer: by talking about enhancing our abilities
by talking about a monkey moving an arm miles away

questions.question: How does he organize the end of the essay (paragraph 17 and on)
What are some things he mentions people will use bionics for?

choices.answer: body parts with mechanical/electronic elements that improve functioning
body parts that are particularly strong
body parts that don't work as they should
body parts that continue to grow and improve with exercise
